tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE security_policies (
    policy_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    policy_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    policy_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE security_controls (
    control_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    control_name VARCHAR(255),
    control_description TEXT,
    control_type VARCHAR(50),
    policy_id UUID REFERENCES security_policies (policy_id)
);

CREATE TABLE security_controls (
    control_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    control_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    control_desc TEXT,
    policy_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (policy_id) REFERENCES security_policies(policy_id)
);

CREATE TABLE cybersecurity_framework (
    framework_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    framework_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    framework_desc TEXT,
    control_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (control_id) REFERENCES security_controls(control_id)
);

CREATE TABLE security_controls (
   control_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   control_name VARCHAR(255),
   control_description TEXT,
   control_type VARCHAR(50),
   policy_id INT,
   FOREIGN KEY (policy_id) REFERENCES security_policies(policy_id)
);

CREATE TABLE procedures (
   procedure_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   procedure_name VARCHAR(255),
   procedure_description TEXT,
   control_id INT,
   FOREIGN KEY (control_id) REFERENCES security_controls(control_id)
);

CREATE TABLE access_logs (
   log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   employee_id INT,
   access_time TIMESTAMP,
   action_taken VARCHAR(50),
   FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
);
